definition: flower drum, a type of double-skinned Chinese drum/folk dance popular in provinces around the middle reaches of the Yangtze/(bicycle wheel) hub
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: Huagu Opera Art is a product of agricultural civilization.
sentences.chinese: 花鼓灯艺术是农耕文明的产物。

sentences.english: The perfect flower to lift spirits or to simply bring joy to someone's day.
sentences.chinese: 完美的花鼓舞精神或干脆带来欢乐的人的一天。

sentences.english: The first chapter directly describes the natural and sociocultural fostering space of Yi flower-drum dance.
sentences.chinese: 第一章直接介入彝族花鼓舞的自然人文生境。

sentences.english: The evolution of traditional scripts of Hunan Flower-Drum Opera can be divided into three periods.
sentences.chinese: 湖南花鼓戏传统剧本的演变可分为三个时期。

sentences.english: So, Flower-Drum performance became a main means using of finding food or begging money.
sentences.chinese: 花鼓表演成为流民觅食乞钱的手段之一。

sentences.english: He cultivates a dandified image and languid manner.
sentences.chinese: 他培养了一个衣冠楚楚的形象和地花鼓。

definition: waist drum/waist-drum dance (Han ethnic group folk dance)
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
percussion instrument in the form of a bamboo fish (traditionally used by Daoist priests)
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
Yangge, a popular rural folk dance
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
